data.title: 准备以至少 30 秒的时间回答以下问题
data.subject: Discuss a time when you learned about a historical event from someone who experienced it firsthand.
data.answer: My grandparent attended the Aiding Korean War. He entered the mountains of North Korea, and he said every soldier carries a heavy load. In addition to firearms, the backpack was also stuffed with fried noodles, rice, bullets, and bandaging supplies. All the food, drink, and war in the backpack, we carry the backpack across the Yalu River. The conditions on the battlefield were extremely difficult. Soldiers eat in the snow, sit in the snow, and sleep in the snow, in order to avoid the reconnaissance of the enemy aircraft, we put the cotton-padded jacket on the other side, so that the white cotton and white snow inside the cotton-padded jacket, can melt together, play a very good hiding effect. After the war, he was awarded the title of the revolutionary soldier and received the commemorative medal.

options.content: How does their firsthand experience differ from how you learned or might learn about it in a book?
